extracted_concepts.definition: A defensive state where an obstacle blocks at least 50% of a target's body.

rule_logic.premise: Target is obstructed by object covering >= 50% of body
rule_logic.implication: Grant +2 Bonus to AC AND +2 Bonus to Dexterity Saving Throws
rule_logic.description_text: A target with half cover has a +2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws. A target has half cover if an obstacle blocks at least half of its body. The obstacle might be a low wall, a large piece of furniture, a narrow tree trunk, or a creature, whether that creature is an enemy or a friend.

extracted_concepts.definition: A defensive state where an obstacle blocks at least 75% of a target's body.

rule_logic.premise: Target is obstructed by object covering >= 75% of body
rule_logic.implication: Grant +5 Bonus to AC AND +5 Bonus to Dexterity Saving Throws
rule_logic.description_text: A target with three-quarters cover has a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws. A target has three-quarters cover if about three-quarters of it is covered by an obstacle. The obstacle might be a portcullis, an arrow slit, or a thick tree trunk.

extracted_concepts.definition: A defensive state where a target is completely concealed by an obstacle.

rule_logic.premise: Target is completely concealed by an obstacle
rule_logic.implication: Target cannot be targeted directly by an attack or spell
rule_logic.description_text: A target with total cover can't be targeted directly by an attack or a spell, although some spells can reach such a target by including it in an area of effect.

extracted_concepts.definition: The procedure for establishing if a target benefits from cover.

rule_logic.premise: A creature or object is between the attacker and the target
rule_logic.implication: Draw a line from any corner of the attacker's space to any corner of the target's space. If one or two of those lines are blocked, the target has half cover. If three or four of those lines are blocked, the target has three-quarters cover.
rule_logic.description_text: To determine whether a target has cover against an attack or a spell, choose one corner of the attacker's space and one corner of the target's space. If a straight line between those two corners passes through or touches an object or another creature (including another enemy's creature) that would block the attack, the target has cover. Work out the amount of cover by using the same point of origin for both the attacker and the target. If you're making a melee attack, the points of origin must be within 5 feet of each other. If you're making a ranged attack, they can be any distance apart. If one or two of those lines are blocked, the target has half cover. If three or four of those lines are blocked, the target has three-quarters cover. A target with total cover (or full cover) is completely concealed by an obstacle and cannot be targeted directly by an attack or a spell.

extracted_concepts.definition: A defensive state where obstacles provide protection against attacks and effects.

rule_logic.premise: An attack or other effect originates on the opposite side of an obstacle
rule_logic.implication: The target can benefit from cover
rule_logic.description_text: A target can benefit from cover only when an attack or other effect originates on the opposite side of the cover.

extracted_concepts.definition: Rule for determining cover degree when a target is behind more than one cover-providing obstacle.

rule_logic.premise: A target is behind multiple sources of cover
rule_logic.implication: Only the most protective degree of cover applies; degrees are not added together
rule_logic.description_text: If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies; the degrees aren't added together.
